Because extractors can't contain any reference, making a `Req` extractor would require to clone the `Req` data which is not ideal.

title: refactor: remove default v3/v4 flag to avoid destructive features
body:
The v4 default flag for the `engineioxide` crate and v5 default flag for the `socketioxide` crate are removed and the corresponding code is enabled by default.

The main goal of this choice is to avoid compilation error when the `no-default-feature` flag is passed

* Issue templates

- [x] Move every common deps to workspace deps
- [ ] Add new examples (see #119) : 
   - [x] [angular-todomvc](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io/tree/main/examples/angular-todomvc)
   - [x] [basic-crud-application](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io/tree/main/examples/basic-crud-application) (only the basic server solution)

title: bench(socketio): add packet encode/decode benchmarks
body: ## Add encode/decode benchmarks for packets

title: feat(socketio/ns): improve connect process
body:
## Improve the connect process by moving it to the `connect` fn in the `ns` module
Thanks to that : 
* The user handler is called only when the connect response is successfully sent trough the channel
* If the socket channel returns an error the socket connection is instantly closed

title: Revert "fix(socketio/socket): create a different socket id for each ns"
body:
Reverts Totodore/socketioxide#123

It appears that solving this issue implies a big refactoring. Indeed referencing socketio socket with custom sid instead is impossible because of the following architecture : 
`client recv data from engine socket -> route to corresponding namespace -> route to corresponding socket with <Engine id -> socket> hashmap`

Because the socket id is not in the request it is impossible to map socket by their socket id (and not their engine id).
The solution would be to refactor the code to match the official architecture : 
`client wraps an engine socket and holds a map of the ns -> socket`.

title: fix: CI was tested only with v3 protocol
Chore(deps): hyper 1.0
body:
## Migrate to hyper 1.0

This migration should be opt-in through a feature flag. It would add : 
* A `hyper::service::Service` to the `EngineIoService` struct with an `hyper::body::Incoming` input type
* A `hyper::service::Service` to the `SocketIoService` struct with an `hyper::body::Incoming` input type
* A `build_server()` on the `SocketIoBuilder` to directly spawn a server, because from 1.0 hyper is dropign its `Server` struct in favour of manual implementation with a `TcpListener`
* Change the body type from `http-body 0.4` to `http-body 1.0`

title: chore(deps): optimize dependencies
body:
* Remove tower-http form socketioxide deps
* remove v4 from default-features
* make tracing optional
* remove all `hyper` features
* set no-default-features on `tower`

title: feat(socketio/ns): store ns path and rooms as `Cow<'static, str>`
body:
## Store ns path and rooms as `Cow<'static, str>` : 
- [x] Change ns path from `String` to `Cow`
- [x] Change rooms in `LocalAdapter` from `String` to `Cow` 
- [x] Change events callbacks in `Socket` from `String` to `Cow`
- [x] Pre-allocate a `String` buffer with a `size_hint` function when encoding to avoid string reallocations
- [x] Decode `Packets` from bytes slice rather than String to avoid `Char` iterators (removes deps itertools)
- [x] Benchmark memory consumption before and after

title: fix(socketio/socket): create a different socket id for each ns
body: This PR fix #117 by creating a different socket id for each new namespace socket for the socketio v5 protocol.

title: feat(engineio/sid): custom sid generation with 128 bit array
body:
Custom sid generation with the base64 crate. 
The applied process is simply to generate 12 random bytes and apply a safe base64 url encoding on it. It will result in a 16 byte base64 id.

The advantages are : 
* Less collision probability
* Removal of the `base64id` dependency

title: chore(versioning): v0.6.0
body:
# Changelog :

## socketioxide
* New API for creating the socket.io layer/service. A cheaply clonable `SocketIo` struct is now returned with the layer/service and allows to access namespaces/rooms/sockets everywhere in the application. Moreover, it is now possible to add and remove namespaces dynamically through the `SocketIo` struct.
* The socket.io `v4` protocol is now available under the feature flag `v4`, it matches every socket.io js version from 1.0.3 to current . The `v5` protocol is still the default and is more performant, it matches every socket.io js version from v3.0.0 to current.

## engineioxide
* The socket parameter for the handler is now an `Arc<Socket>`.
* The `max_payload` option is now applied when encoding a packet. Before, it was only applied when decoding a packet.
* With `websocket` transport, packets are now bufferred before being flushed. Before, they were flushed one by one.

title: fix: apply max payload option when encoding (fix #113)
body:
This PR apply the `max_payload_size` option to the encoding process for polling. Before, it was only applied when decoding.
In order to calculate the size of the payload with the next packet **without** polling it from the channel, a `PeekableReceiver` struct was made to `peek` the next element without polling it.

For the v3 protocol the current payload computed size is not accurate because the size in `chars` of the packet is included in the payload. And getting that information *before* adding the packet is not possible (also it is a O(n) operation). Therefore the max  packet size length is apply, it is the number of digit of the maximum payload size.

title: chore(ci): migrating from official e2e to custom
body: Use custom ci until PR https://github.com/socketio/socket.io-protocol/pull/33 is merged

title: refactor(engineio/engine):  transport module
body:
Add a `transport` module that will contain a module for each transport type:
* polling
* websocket

Moves every transport focused fn that were in the `EngineIo` struct to the corresponding transport module.
Thanks to that the separation is much better and it will be easier to add future new transports.

Flush the websocket stream only when the internal channel is drained

title: fix(clippy): issue #104
body: Close #104

title: fix: move `tx_map_fn` & `close_fn` declaration to Engine impl
refactor: Minor optimization and fixes
body: No major changes, just cleanups.

title: chore(deps): Release 0.5.1
body:
engineioxide@0.5.1
socketioxide@0.5.1

title: fix(engine.io): data race for the noop packet
body:
If the polling connection needed to get a noop packet is not made in time (before the end of the upgrade handshake). The NOOP packet will then be sent trough the websocket and cause an protocol error.

To fix this issue the handler that send the packets between the buffer and the websocket filter out all Noop packets.

This PR also improve logging.

title: feat: cheaply clonable io struct
body:
With a cheaply clonable io struct that handle a reference to all the namespaces it will be possible to access all sockets in any namespace from anywhere in the program.

It will also simplify the building process. `NamespaceBuilder` and `SocketIoConfigBuilder` will be merged under a `SocketIoBuilder` struct that will contains methods to create either a `Layer` or a `Service`. It will also return the `SocketIo` cloneable struct.

This PR includes :
* The creation of a `SocketIo` struct to build a config and create a `Layer` or a `Service`.
* The creation of namespaces is now dynamic and is done directly through the `SocketIo` struct. This also allow to have dynamic handlers with auth data type bound to it
* The SocketIo struct allow to access any namespaces/rooms/socket.
* The removal of the config and handshake mod.

Closes #60

title: Test: Add test suite for socket.io packet encoding
body:
Add tests for all the socket.io packets types.
Fix a bug with binary packets with namespaces : namespace was put before the payload count whereas it should be put after according to the payload datagram : 
```
<packet type>[<# of binary attachments>-][<namespace>,][<acknowledgment id>][JSON-stringified payload without binary]

+ binary attachments extracted
```

title: chore: prepare v0.5.0
body:
# Bump version to v0.5.0

## socketioxide
* A [`on_disconnect`](https://docs.rs/socketioxide/latest/socketioxide/struct.Socket.html#method.on_disconnect) function is now available on the `Socket` instance. The provided callback will be called when the socket disconnects with the reasons for the disconnection. This is useful for logging or cleanup data.
* A [`connect_timeout`](https://docs.rs/socketioxide/latest/socketioxide/struct.SocketIoConfigBuilder.html#method.connect_timeout) option is now available in the config options. It is the maximum time to wait for a socket.io handshake before closing the connection. The default is 45 seconds.
* A [`NsHandlers`](https://docs.rs/socketioxide/latest/socketioxide/struct.NsHandlers.html) struct was added. It describes namespace handlers passed to the SocketIoLayer/SocketIoService. Before, it was a type alias for a HashMap and it was containing types that were not supposed to be public.

## engineioxide
* A [`DisconnectReason`](https://docs.rs/engineioxide/latest/engineioxide/enum.DisconnectReason.html) enum is passed to the `on_disconnect` callback of the engine handler.
* Bump `tokio-tungstenite` to 0.20.1.

title: chore(ci): add release/test flag to key to separate caches
feat(socketio): connect timeout implementation
body:
### In socket.io v4 a [`connect_timeout`](https://socket.io/fr/docs/v4/server-options/#connecttimeout) parameter should be provided in the config. 
It is used to drop the engine.io connexion if the client **did not send a CONNECT request** to any namespace after the engine.io handshake.

A PR to add this feature to the test-suite has been issued : https://github.com/socketio/socket.io-protocol/pull/31

title: feat(socketio/ns): create a wrapper struct for NsHandlers and export it
body:
## Create a wrapper struct for `NsHandlers` rather than a type alias and export it.

This will allow to hide the underlying type : `HashMap<String, EventCallback<A>>`

title: fix(socketioxide): socket.io config for custom transport list
body: ## Socket.io config now has a custom transport list

title: chore(versioning): v0.4.0
body:
## New version v0.4.0 🚀:

close error #64 and #62.

title: feat(engineioxide): specific transport restrictions (fix issue #49)
body:
This PR adds a field in the `EngineIoConfig` struct so the user is able to specify a limited number of transports, by default all transports are allowed).

For example, only `websocket` requests will be allowed, but `polling` request will be denied with a `400 Bad Request` error.

```rust
let conf = EngineIoConfig::builder()
            .transports([TransportType::Websocket])
            .build();
```

title: feat(engineioxide/v3) binary encoding payload
body:
Add binary payloads support for v3.

It will fix CI and allow to fully support engine.io v3.
Steps : 

- [x] binary encoder
- [x] binary decoder
- [x] fix `closes the session upon invalid packet format` in v3
- [ ] ~~benchmark decoding encoding and compare stream decoding with previous buffered implementation~~

title: chore(deps): Update tokio-tungstenite requirement from 0.19.0 to 0.20.0 in /engineioxide

labels.name: C-Dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [tokio-tungstenite](https://github.com/snapview/tokio-tungstenite) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from tokio-tungstenite's changelog.

0.20.0

  • Change the buffering behavior for Sink::send() and Sink::feed(), see tungstenite's changelog for more details.

0.19.0

  • Allow users to enable/disable Nagle algorithm when using connect() helpers.
  • Improve the behavior of the Sink for the WebSocketStream, so it does not return an error when it’s not necessary (when poll_flush() is called on a connection that has just been closed).
  • Workaround an issue where rustls TLS backend expected domain in a certain format and reject IPv6 addresses if they contained square brackets in them.
  • Update dependencies and remove unused errors.

0.18.0

  • Update dependencies (underlying tungstenite core).

0.17.2

  • Make Origin header case-sensitive (to keep compatibility with poorely-written servers that don't accept lowercase Origin header).
  • Make semantics of the reading form the WebSocketStream more reasonable (return None instead of an error when the stream is normally closed).
  • Imrpove the way poll_close() works by properly driving the close of the stream till completion.

0.17.1

  • Update the tungstenite dependency (fixes a panic in tungstenite and MSRV), see tungstenite's changelog for more details.

0.17.0

  • Update the dependencies, please refer to the tungstenite changelog for the actual changes.

0.16.1

  • Fix feature selection problem when using TLS.

0.16.0

  • Add a function to allow to specify the TLS connector when using connect() like logic.
  • Add support for choosing the right root certificates for the TLS.
  • Change the behavior of the connect() so that it fails when using TLS without TLS feature.
  • Do not project with Unpin.
  • Update the dependencies with important implications / improvements.

0.15.0

  • Update the tungstenite-rs version to 0.14.0, check tungstenite-rs release for more details.

0.14.0

  • Support for rustls as TLS backend.
    • The tls feature was renamed to native-tls and uses a OS-native TLS implementation.

... (truncated)

title: docs: add contributing guidelines
body:
Add contributing guidelines (heavily inspired by https://github.com/nestjs/nest/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
It contains :
* Issues guidelines
* Commit & PR naming conventions
* Formating conventions


Closes #45

title: chore(ci): add engineio ci for v4 and ci for v3 & v4
body:
Add e2e testing for engine.io V4 and V3 and V4 simultaneously.
Closes #15

title: Ft improve payload parsing
body:
Upgraded Packet Reader to correctly calculate the packet length when handling Unicode characters. This change was necessary because the previous design would incorrectly size Unicode characters as single bytes. Additional dependency `unicode-segmentation` was introduced to use Unicode segmentation algorithm for correct grapheme counting.

Updated tests to verify the new implementation and made modifications in Cargo.toml and Cargo.lock accordingly. Featured 'v4' and 'v3' were updated to depend on 'unicode-segmentation.'

It still needed to be refactored, but at least it works somehow

title: Feat: improve payload parsing
body:
This PR includes : 

- [x] better `Payload` parsing by directly returning a parsed packet to avoid any string allocation
- [x] fixing malicious length input from the user in v3
- [x] applying max_payload size to the `hyper::aggregate` fn to avoid server crash with malicious input
- [x] supporting utf8 packet parsing in v3

title: feat(socketioxide/v4): implement SocketIO V4 (closes #51)
body:
Protocol implementation steps:

- [x] Add implicit connection to the default namespace
- ~~rename `CONNECT_ERROR` to `ERROR`~~ Not necessary because the value hasn't changed, only the name. 
- [x] The `CONNECT` packet shouldn't contain a payload
- [ ] The payload `CONNECT_ERROR` should be a plain string instead of an object. *I might skip implementing this, I think a v4 client currently would receive a JSON string as the error, which isn't a big deal.*
- [x] Add E2E tests (WIP: https://github.com/sleeyax/socket.io-protocol/tree/v4-testsuite)

title: Fix invalid ping timeout in v3 protocol
body:
From the v3 protocol spec:

> Since the two values are shared between the server and the client, the server will also be able to detect whether the client becomes unresponsive when it does not receive any data within pingTimeout + pingInterval.

title: Fix failing EngineIO CI configuration
body: I was just missing the `build` command. I assumed `cargo run` would already build + run the binary, not sure why it doesn't seem to work that way though. Anyways, this commit should fix it.

title: Set up code formatting
body:
This PR includes : 
* VSCode format on save as a default workspace setting
* rust fmt check in CI script

title: feat(socketioxide): disconnect handler
body:
Currently there is no way for the end user to execute code when the socket is disconnected.

Now, it will be possible to add an handler executed when the socket is disconnected:
* Gracefully from the server
* Gracefully from the client
* When the transport closed or crashed

There will be a `DisconnectReason` enum provided so the user knows what caused the disconnect event.

Steps : 

- [x] `on_disconnect` handler on socketioxide `Socket`.
- [x] `DisconnectReason` on engineioxide
- [x] `DisconnectReason` on socketioxide
- [ ] ~~Errors provided for `TransportError` variant on the `DisconnectReason`~~

title: Feature: Error Adapter
body:
Currently the `Adapter` trait was not returning any error. However for future remote adapters it will be necessary.

Therefore the `Adapter` has now a bounded Error type.

For the `LocalAdapter` it is an `Infallible` error.

In order to handle these error without adding generic adapter to all the errors, there is now an error wrapper `AdapterError` which wraps a `Box<dyn std::error>`.

title: Handle ordering bin packets
body:
current mechanism of retrying/resending packets in socketioxide can brake flow in case of retry launches when another binary payload sends.
moreover, if anybody tries to send packets and one of them includes binary attachment,it can break flow also.

Suggested solution:

1. create new private struct PacketSender containing channel and queue of failed messages.
2. Socket owns Packet sender guarded by mutex
3. when user tryes to send packet it locks mutex and uses packet sender

internal packet sender logic:

1. if main message succesfully sent, but sending of attachments fails, packet sender saves a queue of failed messages internally. It can be sent in next send call before sending the new packet, or send_binaries function call (privately from Socket)
2. if after new send call sending of failed queue attachments fails again it will return   SendFailedBinPayloads containing provided packet to give an opportunity for user to send it again
3. if sending of main message fails it will return it will return RetryablePacket(it's a queue of deserialized main packet and binary payloads). this struct has only one method retry, accepting a socket.

public API changes:
socket.retry_failed() - tries to resend failed queue messages
AckSender returns error containing socket and SendError to make it possible to resend ack

title: Handle send error
body:
use closure to handle fullchannel error, test checking it
resolves #27

title: Revert "handling send to socket error"
body: Reverts Totodore/socketioxide#31

title: Removing arc from handler property in `Engine`
body:
The handler property is never used outside of the `Engine` struct and was behind an `Arc<H>`. 
This adds a layer of indirection for each calls to the handler.

Removing the Arc implies that the `Handler` (and therefore the `Client` struct in the `socketioxide` crate) is created multiple times at startup by the layer (if used with axum for example).

title: handling send to socket error
body:
fix #27 
create SendError enum, BroadcastError
handle these errors

@Totodore I left todos in places where I don't know how to handle error correctly

title: Set content-type and charset
body:
set content type header.
it's better for client to decode response,  it's good also for debugging using sniffers

title: Add Warp usage example & split examples and e2e testing
body:
* Adds [socketio-echo/warp_echo.rs](examples/src/socketio-echo/warp_echo.rs)
* Adds [engineio-echo/warp_echo.rs](examples/src/engineio-echo/warp_echo.rs)
* Removes all weird configurations used to test correct protocol implementation with test-suites.
* All test implementations are now in the `e2e` package
* Refactor some unused fn in Service struct

title: Feature: implement EngineIO V3 (closes #22)
body:
Here's some initial progress on the V3 implementation. Please provide detailed feedback if you can, I don't consider myself proficient in Rust yet.

Protocol implementation steps:
- [x] Use counting of characters instead of a record separator (\x1e)
- [x] Reverse ping/pong mechanism
- [ ] Support non-base64-encoded binary payload

E2E tests: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io-protocol/pull/45

title: connection error handling: unsupported version, unsupported transport, bad handshake method
body:
In case of request contains unsupported transport or version, the server replies with code and message according 
[protocol
](https://socket.io/docs/v4/server-instance/)

```
Code | Message
-- | --
0 | "Transport unknown"
1 | "Session ID unknown"
2 | "Bad handshake method"
3 | "Bad request"
5 | "Unsupported protocol version"

```

title: change sid generator, use sid type alias
body:
resolves #2 
create Sid type alias
generate random secure number
use base64Id to convert number to constant-length string

title: Examples + Refactoring
body:
This pull requests adds :
* Hyper echo examples
* Axum chat app example (with a `CorsLayer`configured #16)
* Some benchmarks for EngineIo polling requests
* Socket Extensions to store data inside sockets. 

It also contains a refactoring of the architecture, between SocketIo Client & the EngineIo structs there was a circular dependency that is now removed.

* Removing logs println
* Improving documentation
* Adding Socket Extensions

title: Chore(deps): Bump h2 from 0.3.16 to 0.3.17

labels.name: C-Dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [h2](https://github.com/hyperium/h2) from 0.3.16 to 0.3.17.
Release notes

Sourced from h2's releases.

v0.3.17

What's Changed

  • Add Error::is_library() method to check if the originated inside h2.
  • Add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(usize) option to client and server builders.
  • Fix theoretical memory growth when receiving too many HEADERS and then RST_STREAM frames faster than an application can accept them off the queue. (CVE-2023-26964)
Changelog

Sourced from h2's changelog.

0.3.17 (April 13, 2023)

  • Add Error::is_library() method to check if the originated inside h2.
  • Add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(usize) option to client and server builders.
  • Fix theoretical memory growth when receiving too many HEADERS and then RST_STREAM frames faster than an application can accept them off the queue. (CVE-2023-26964)

  • 45b9bcc chore: set rust-version in Cargo.toml (#664)
